title: New class wizard doesn't get context right for nested classes
description: When using the new class wizard to create a nested class, the context is not properly set.
OB: When creating a nested class using the new class wizard, the wizard does not correctly set the context. The wizard creates the class as a top-level class instead of a nested class within the intended parent class.
EB: When creating a nested class using the new class wizard, the wizard should correctly set the context and create the class as a nested class within the intended parent class.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open the new class wizard.
2. Select the option to create a nested class.
3. Choose a parent class.
4. Complete the wizard and observe that the nested class is created as a top-level class instead of a nested class within the selected parent class.
